JOSEPH JOHN THOMSON

‚öõÔ∏èJJ Thomson discovered the electron in 1897, which proved that atoms were not indivisible, as previously thought.

data.text:
Greetings of the day! The B M Birla Science Centre (BMBSC), Hyderabad, is thrilled to announce the launch of the "G P Birla Fundamental Astronomy Course for Amateurs". This unique course provides a comprehensive understanding of astronomy for amateur enthusiasts through a combination of theoretical, observational, and hands-on sessions. It is designed for those keenly interested in unravelling the mysteries of the universe. Details of the course: Course Syllabus The course curriculum will cover a wide range of topics, which includes both theoretical and Practical/Observational Sessions, including but not limited to: ‚óèIntroduction to Astronomy ‚óèCelestial Astronomy ‚óèObservational Tools & Techniques ‚óèSolar System and Planetary Science ‚óèStellar Astronomy ‚óèGalaxies and Cosmology ‚óèSpace Exploration ‚óèLife in the Universe The Practical/Observational Astronomy sessions include model-making, understanding the night sky - using star charts, telescope assembling & handling, and Solar & Moon Observations. *ELIGIBILITY: Open for all Individuals, including students in Grade IX and above. *DURATION: 08 Weeks - AUGUST - SEPTEMBER, 2024 *SCHEDULE: 11 AM - 01 PM & 02 PM - 04 PM on Every Sunday *COURSE FEES: ‚Çπ 3000 (for School and College Students) & ‚Çπ 4500 (for Others) **LAST DATE FOR REGISTRATION: July 31, 2024** For further queries, Contact: Course Coordinator, 8186862621 Circulate the poster among enthusiasts.

The B M Birla Science Centre (BMBSC), Hyderabad, is thrilled to announce the launch of the "GP Birla Fundamental Astronomy Course for Amateurs". This unique course provides a comprehensive understanding of astronomy for amateur enthusiasts through a combination of theoretical, observational, and hands-on sessions. It is designed for those keenly interested in unravelling the mysteries of the universe. The course curriculum will cover a wide range of topics, which includes both theoretical and Practical/Observational Sessions, including but not limited to: üååIntroduction to Astronomy üååCelestial Astronomy üî≠Observational Tools & Techniques üåïSolar System and Planetary Science ‚≠êÔ∏èStellar Astronomy üååGalaxies and Cosmology üõ∞Space Exploration üß¨Life in the Universe The Practical/Observational Astronomy sessions include model-making, understanding the night sky - using star charts, telescope assembling & handling, and Solar & Moon Observations. ELIGIBILITY: Open for all Individuals, including students in Grade IX and above. DURATION: 08 Weeks - AUGUST - SEPTEMBER, 2024 LAST DATE FOR REGISTRATION: July 31, 2024 Look into the poster for further details! https://lnkd.in/gT5VVa5N

Bhartiya Antariksh Hackathon (BAH) ‚Äì 2024 As part of the National Space Day 2024 celebrations, ISRO has organized the Bhartiya Antariksh Hackathon. This event will feature twelve problem statements on Geo-Spatial Applications from esteemed ISRO centres: NRSC, PRL, NESAC, SPL, and SAC. Teams of 3-4 Indian students from undergraduate, postgraduate, and PhD programs are invited to participate. The Bhartiya Antariksh hackathon involves a rigorous two-level screening process. Initially, 100 teams will be shortlisted based on their ideation and relevance to the problem statements. From these, an expert committee will select 30 teams for the grand finale. The grand finale, a 30-hour marathon event, will be held at the NRSC Outreach Facility in Jeedimetla, Hyderabad, starting at 10:00 hrs IST on August 13, 2024. The hackathon event is managed through a dedicated web portal. Proposals can be submitted through the portal until July 26, 2024. The list of teams advancing to the grand finale will be announced on August 2, 2024. ISRO Chairman Dr. S. Somanath will formally launch the Bhartiya Antariksh Hackathon (BAH) ‚Äì 2024 web portal on July 4, 2024, at 10:30 hrs IST. This event will be streamed live on ISRO‚Äôs YouTube channel, and all enthusiasts are welcome to tune in. https://lnkd.in/g2RqHc9k

27th International Conference on Particle Physics and Cosmology (COSMO2024) 21-25 October 2024. Kyoto, Japan COSMO is an annual international conference on particle physics and cosmology, covering the following main topics: Dark Matter, Neutrinos and Astroparticle Physics; Gravitational Waves and Black Holes; InÔ¨Çation and the primordial universe; Large Scale Structure; ModiÔ¨Åed Gravity and Dark Energy; Radiocosmology, CMB and 21cm; Statistical Methods and Tensions in Cosmology. The conference will bring together leading researchers on these topics from around the world to report their latest research results and engage in lively discussions for future research. Registration is open at the conference website. For on-site participation, registration and payment deadlines are July 31 and August 15, 2024. For virtual participation, registration and payment deadlines are August 31 and September 15, 2024. For Registration: https://lnkd.in/gAYMMKzc For more details contact: cosmo2024kyoto@gmail.com

IWARA ‚Äì International Workshop on Astronomy and Relativistic Astrophysics 2024 The event is the 11th in a series of meetings gathering scientists working on astroparticle physics, cosmology, gravitation, nuclear physics, and related fields. As in previous years, the IWARA 2024 meeting sessions will consist of exclusively in person invited and contributed talks, poster sessions, and will cover recent developments in the following topics: ‚Ä¢New phenomena and new states of matter in the Universe ‚Ä¢General relativity, gravitation, cosmology ‚Ä¢New directions for general relativity: past, present and future of general relativity ‚Ä¢FRW cosmologies ‚Ä¢Cosmic microwave background radiation ‚Ä¢First Stars, hypernovae, and faint supernovae in the early Universe ‚Ä¢Quantum gravity and quantum cosmology ‚Ä¢Gravity and the unification of fundamental interactions ‚Ä¢Supersymmetry and Inflation ‚Ä¢String theory ‚Ä¢White dwarfs, neutron stars and pulsars ‚Ä¢Black hole physics and astrophysics ‚Ä¢Gamma-ray emission in the Universe ‚Ä¢High energy cosmic rays ‚Ä¢Gravitational waves ‚Ä¢Dark energy and dark matter ‚Ä¢Strange matter and strange stars ‚Ä¢Antimatter in the Universe ‚Ä¢High-energy cosmic neutrinos ‚Ä¢Blazars ‚Ä¢Quantum chromodynamics, nuclear and particle physics and new states of matter in the Universe. ‚Ä¢Heavy ion collisions and the formation of the quark-gluon plasma in heavy ion collisions and in the first instants of the Universe ‚Ä¢Strong magnetic fields in the Universe, strong magnetic fields in compact stars and in galaxies, ultra-strong magnetic fields in neutron star mergers, quark stars and magnetars, strong magnetic fields and the cosmic microwave background ‚Ä¢Laboratories, observatories, telescopes and other experimental and observational facilities that will define the future directions of astrophysics, astronomy, cosmology, nuclear and astroparticle physics as well as the future of physics at the energy frontiers, and topics related to these. The event will be organized by Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos ‚Äì UNMSM (Lima, Per√∫) and the Universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco - UNSAAC (Cusco, Per√∫). During the IWARA2024 event, the Pacha Kutiy Inqa Yupanki Prize will be awarded to the top five student contributions of the poster session. Pachacuti was the ninth Sapa Inca (1438‚Äì1471) of the Kingdom of Cusco, which he transformed into the Inca Empire. Most archaeologists believe that the Inca site of Machu Picchu was built as an estate for Pachacuti. Registration is open Deadline Aug 6, 2024 For registration & other details: https://lnkd.in/g7Tf_syC
